Role in Curriculum

The course will be a mathematics elective for undergraduates interested in applied mathematics.

Learning Goals and Assessment Plans

Learning GoalAssessment
The students will learn basic theory and
techniques for solving first order linear and
quasilinear PDE’s in two Independent variables.		When the class is being assessed, the final exams
will include embedded questions to assess student
performance on these topic-specific learning
goals. Instructors are resposible for tallying
their students scores.
The student will learn the theory of
classification of second order, linear, PDE’s
in two independent variables and how solve
equations by putting them into canonical form.		same
The student will learn some basic theory and
methods of solution for the heat equation, wave
equation, and the Laplace equation.		same

When assessment activities are done, the results will be summarized in memorandum form and filed with the department chairperson for record keeping
purposes.

Information obtained from assessment will be used to assess and self-reflect on the success of the course and to make any necessary changes to
improve teaching and learning effectiveness.
